keyword: how many calories in a bottle of wine
title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a bottle of wine, including carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for red, white, or sweet types in this quick nutrition guide.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine (red or white), ~12% ABV, minimal residual sugar, no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, alcohol content, sweetness, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine has about 625 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Red wine vs. white (slightly higher tannins/antioxidants, minor cal difference)

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine.

faqs.q: Does white wine have fewer calories than red?
faqs.a: Similarâ€”both around 625 kcal per bottle for dry varieties; differences are minimal.

faqs.q: Are calories in wine from alcohol or sugar?
faqs.a: Mostly from alcohol (~80%), with small amounts from carbs and residual sugars in dry wines.

faqs.q: How many calories per glass of wine?
faqs.a: A standard 5 oz (150 ml) glass has ~125 kcal, so a 750 ml bottle equals about 5 glasses.

faqs.q: Does wine have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: Dry wine has ~7 g carbs per bottle (low sugars) and negligible protein (~1 g).
